website_summaries.verdict: It's reasonably-priced, has good sound, and sports basic functions that suit most users needs – an overall impressive package for the budget-conscious shopper.
pros: In addition to producing clear, balanced sound, it can play a CD while changing up to 5 others without interrupting your listening experience
cons: The design is somewhat bulky and takes up more space than similar models
Some faulty units upon arrival have been reported

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I purchased this
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. I was a little gun shy given some of the negative reviews. But I have used this CD changer about 15-30 times with a full 6 cd rack (so 5 hours of playing at a time). some of my CDs are over 20 years old and some are new. it has worked perfect for me. I also use the 'programable' feature to program certain songs on specific CDs (i.e create a playlist of any of the songs on the CDs you put in) - it's always worked for me. I have a Yamaha receiver. I shopped around quite bit before purchasing this. I feel good about my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Jon

customer_reviews.title: This changer works great! I am very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: This changer works great! I am very happy with my purchase. It is large so you need room in a stereo cabinet. Other than the size I am completely satisfied. It plays well without distortion. CDs can be changed while one is playing. Random features work well. I haven't tried the memory function as yet. You will be pleased if you have a lot of CDs that are older. I have mine attached to the surround speaker system for home theater. It sounds great and I can get hours of music, Very pleased customer here.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnette A.

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mother to replace a similar Sony 5 cd unit that finally died after 20+ years. The Onkyo player is GREAT. She LOVES it. If you still have tons of cds and haven't yet succumbed to the "just stream it via Spotify" trend, this is a great unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Down & Out in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: 3 months in and the machines brain is not working. The shuffle doesn't work; it plays one disc then stops; skips discs; gives odd readings on its faceplate as to what is happening etc. It was fine for 3 months, now this. I tried all the basic restart things to clear the units computer to no avail. Will try calling Onkyo America tomorrow to see what they say .
customer_reviews.author: Michael Levonas

customer_reviews.title: It is awesome and looks great love How it plays 6 disc and u can even do on random very cool!
customer_reviews.text: I love this onkyo CD player it is perfect for me because I listen to a lot of cds all day so I had a one disc CD player.Now haveing this 6 disc one is a lot easier!I don't have to open up and take out and put in a cd every single time now I can listen to 6 cds that I choose non stop or repeat or if I wanna mix it up put it on random.It also looks very nice and the green light in the middle looks very nice looking better then in the picture.I had it one day and I love like it this much already.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Disposable quality, very poor durablility
customer_reviews.text: After years of good service from Onkyo recievers, I bought this Cd player for the 6 disc feature. You don't buy players of this price range for premium sound quality, but it sounded good on my system. After 14 months of regular use, however, it no longer loads a cd from the carousel, rendering it useless. All other functions are apparently intact. Not impressed. Have had other players that lasted years of hard everyday use, so I have to believe that this is an issue of the manufacturers quality control, or simply their indifference to customer satisfaction and electronic waste. Don't waste your time and money to fill the landfill with this one!
customer_reviews.author: ShoppingForPorcupine

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: This CD player quit working the 4th time I used it. Says "Mechanical Error" In my opinion don't not buy as it is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: BC3

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to return
customer_reviews.text: This may be a fine product but if you find you ordered the wrong thing for your needs, heaven help you. I was given a return label valid for 14 days. My mother died after 5. Yes this is a true story. Amazon customer service is impossible. The extent of their run around as one tries to find a live person to help is astonishing in its ridiculous complexity. I did it once, but I have never penetrated the circular nonsense again. I will try my best to make this story public...it matters not to Amazon of course, but one must try.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Onkyo no thank you
customer_reviews.text: another Onkyo junk product. never again. This CD changer did not work out of the box. Came without the remote, so it obviously was a return. I had a Onkyo receiver for the TV amplifier that lasted maybe a year before it burned out.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Pecan Rancher

customer_reviews.title: when it worked, it worked well....but
customer_reviews.text: Mixed review. When it played well, it really played well. But I found that I had several disc that had sections where I would loose the sound from one speaker, or cracking/popping sound, always at the same place. When these disc were tried in another player they worked fine. I spoke with a technician who said it was s tracking problem of the machine. I was very pleased that the return was rapid and easy. I may try another of the same product. I remain impressed with Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: william m birdsong

customer_reviews.title: Stopped functioning within a year
customer_reviews.text: Junk. My other players lasted for decades. OLD REVIEW: 4 stars. NEW REVIEW: 1 star
customer_reviews.author: Plant ecology

customer_reviews.title: Works well but is huge
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 25 year old RCA changer that just decided to stop playing CDs. So far it works well, and produces good sound through my old system. Two things I don't like about it. First is its huge size. It is much bigger than any components I have had. It is 17 1/8 inches wide, 17 inches deep, and 5 3/16 inches tall. I had to cut a full size hole in the back of my cabinet for it to fit (and stick out the back.) It also has an annoying red light that indicates standby (there is no OFF.)
customer_reviews.author: Rancher

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the positive reviews for this CD Player!
customer_reviews.text: Ignore the positive reviews on this CD player. Seemed fine initially, but started having problems on day 31. Usually hangs on the higher up tracks. Might as well buy a cheaper player, because there really isn't any reliability and quality in this CD player. You just have to take the time and rip all those CD's to USB and play you music that way because Onkyo has joined the rest of the manufactures in selling everyone absolute junk.
customer_reviews.author: Zanywiseguy

customer_reviews.title: High risk purchase - very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: At first, the unit skipped or would not play. The troubleshooting section recommended leaving the unit on for several hours to dispel any condensation. This seemed to work at the time. Unfortunately, after owning this unit for just over a month, the player will play a few seconds of a cd and stop, perhaps restart(only to stop after a few seconds), or just completely stop. This unit is unacceptable as a product for sale. Whether the issue is poor engineering or poor manufacturing(or both), the result is the same - a piece of junk. Offering something of this poor quality for sale is borderline fraudulent. Onkyo has no pride in workmanship at all, evidently.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Payton

customer_reviews.title: Love it but it is very large
customer_reviews.text: Nice sound and easy to install. The only issue is that it would be nice to have a remote control and also, this is very large! I am happy if fit in the spot but it took up much more room than expected. I would buy it again though because it works well and has great sound.
customer_reviews.author: A Loyal Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Plays discs good though when not dusty
customer_reviews.text: For the most part it does what it is supposed to but every other month I have to take the housing apart and clean the laser from the dust build up. I need to do this when the changer starts skipping discs and not seeing a disc when there is one. I clean the dust off my discs weekly. Don't know why this device needs so much dust attention when my DVD player does not. Plays discs good though when not dusty.
customer_reviews.author: tony pett

customer_reviews.title: I was able to plug it in to my "old component system" with no problem and the sound is perfect. And I am able to enjoy all my ...
customer_reviews.text: My old Panasonic CD player died and I debated about buying a new one. When I saw this advertised on Amazon, I immediately ordered it. I was able to plug it in to my "old component system" with no problem and the sound is perfect. And I am able to enjoy all my old loved CDs music again!
customer_reviews.author: Georgeanne Y.

customer_reviews.title: Had to return it the second day. Skipped tracks ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it the second day. Skipped tracks on multiple CD's. Checked to make sure my disc's were clean. They were. I have no use for a brand new product that will not function properly.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Easy to install and the best sound of ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Easy to install and the best sound of our CD's is beautiful. Easy to use the remote with our Receiver remote. Recommend others to purchase this Onkyo DXC390 6 Disc CD Changer ...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Huge!
customer_reviews.text: Holy cripe, I can't believe no one mentioned the size of this thing in any of the reviews I read (I didn't read them all, but many). It is a full 2" deeper than my stereo cabinet PLUS the cables sticking out the back. Who makes a component for a stereo that doesn't fit a normal stereo cabinet? I had a 6 CD changer in there before, so that's not the reason. Can't complain about the sound but I think this is a relevant piece of information.
customer_reviews.author: Java

customer_reviews.title: Additional Review and Clarification
customer_reviews.text: I made a previous recent review regarding the slow pause in between selections but left out the fact that it is in RANDOM when it happens and is understandable. I like my RANDOM or SHUTTLE modes to mix quickly like seamlessly DJ ing but as I pointed out these slow pauses can be worked around even within a single player. Yes I have two multi CD Onkyo players and I'm a customer satisfied with an excellent product. I may buy more for other rooms and media players I have. Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Nelson A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Multi disc players are getting hard to find. This is a good one, fidelity to great compared to the Pioneer it replaced. It is large, almost to deep for my cabinet be sure to allow for that.
customer_reviews.author: Kinglong1

customer_reviews.title: CD listening PLEASURE!
customer_reviews.text: I have no issue with the Quality, performance, features, or price. I find this a great value. I had a Sony 5 disc I bought in '86, and lightning got in in summer 2017. So, I have this one going on 8 months, and I think I will get the same reliability, and years of listening pleasure. I was going to get another Sony for sure, but the price on this one & customer ratings/remarks made me make the jump, feeling safe saving $$ and still getting equal quality. Only time can prove me right or wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Dale R. Sandt

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: PRO: the purchase price was right for me. The quality of sound and model structure is great! I listen to all types of music from A -Z and found that this Onkyo, Model#DXC390 does just what I expected. When changing/ skipping from disc - disc. I haven't experienced any distorted sounds or noise; as other's have mentioned.CON: can't give this purchase 5 stars because some disc have been skipping while in playing mode. Nevertheless, I won't return this 6 Disc changer because it's convenient,comes with remote, visible display board light/dimmer so you can see at distance what's playing. This changer replaced an older KLM model 5 disc changer and I'm satisfied!!! I will recommend to friends and family
customer_reviews.author: Ladyda

customer_reviews.title: Random Mode Not What I Wanted - Returned It
customer_reviews.text: - This CD changer worked well, except for the "random" mode function. My old CD changer (a Sony that lasted 26 years) would play all songs on all CDs in random - without repeating any song. (When all songs were played the music simply stopped and I liked this feature.) - While the Onkyo DXC390 6 Disc CD Changer worked well in all other ways, I didn't like hearing the same song within a few minutes of its previous play. (Sometimes more than twice within an hour or so.) - If you don't care about using the random mode then this CD changer will be fine for your use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Keller

customer_reviews.title: Works but frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: THe player itself plays CDs well. The problems are it was a 6 disc changer and I thought I was getting a 5 disc model. So the 6 disc changer it much deeper than the 5 disc type so it is much larger (deeper) than the 5 disc type, larger than any of my other components. It sticks out from my media center. And the changer disc holder only allows you to load 5 discs. No mater how many times you hit the skip disc function Disc number one never comes to the front for loading. Just dumb design.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Plays CDs from my collection
customer_reviews.text: Unit works well and sound great. But there are a couple of issues that are somewhat annoying. 1. The unit is very sensitive to vibrations. It sits on top of a cabinet and just closing a door or drawer can cause a skip in the music. 2. The unit does not power down completely. There is no off on it, just a standby mode thus it is always drawing some energy. 3. The memory play feature works well, but at times is very cantankerous to program. The manual is semi-helpful on its use, but I ended up just pushing buttons until I got it to work. They need to refine the manual a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Allen99

customer_reviews.title: Handy multi-CD player with good randomizing.
customer_reviews.text: A CD player that can randomize the contents of several CDs is vital to our Yuletide music listening. We have an extensive holiday music library, very eclectic tastes, and enjoy making up new combinations of styles. We've gone through at least 3 similar from Sony. They did the job until they died, but that kept happening faster and faster. So this time we tried a new brand- with the plus that it holds 6 CDs rather than 5. So far so good! We're certainly enjoying our music again! It seems to be working very well.
customer_reviews.author: CissaTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one and it never played more than half a dozen songs before stopping. I returned that one for a replacement and had EXACTLY the same problem with the new one! What good is having a multi-disc player if you can't use the function for what is was intended?? Purchased one for over twice as much because I was totally frustrated. Works perfectly but after having to pay that much more, think I should be compensated for the time and trouble of having to ship 2 back!
customer_reviews.author: James Eberhart

customer_reviews.title: I greatly dislike writing bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived in great shape. It arrived quickly. However, it could not recognize a single disc nor any of all 6 discs I place into the bays. Telephone call to EZ was an exercise in futility. Phone menu produced a connection which went right back to the original menu message of which button to press for this or that service. Product returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Nuclear Me

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with Onkyo
customer_reviews.text: It crapped out after two weeks of use and I had to send it back to the dealer. They refunded me okay so kudos to Amazon but the Onkyo player was marginal even when it worked. I have since bought a Yamaha 6600 and it is way better - quieter changing discs and better sound; worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: TOM ATKINS

customer_reviews.title: A Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: In this age of flash drives, Music Players, CD's DVD's, etc. this is a welcome relief, in that it will turntable favorites. I gave it three stars because it came with no instructions for setup and how to use the various buttons on the face of the console. So far it has been by guess and by da.....ng. Were I just a little more confused, I would have returned the product, and would surely look to the manufacturer to read this review and help out some.
customer_reviews.author: tommie tucker

customer_reviews.title: SOUNDS VERY GOOD. QUIRKY ON COUTINUOUS PLAY
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and the sound quality is very good. I still have not figured out how to keep continuously playing CDs. If I change out CD 1 & 2 after they have played, it will continue playing CDs 3-6 but then stops. Why won't it go on and play the new CD1 or 2?
customer_reviews.author: alohajack

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable!!! Have had this cd player for less then two weeks before it went completely dead. Bought this to replace a 15 year old Yamaha that was making a little a clicking noise when changing discs. I had purchased an Onkyo cd player 25 years ago that went out after a couple of years but thought I would give them another chance. Never again!!!! I realize they don't make electronics to last but less then two weeks is ridiculous. I hooked up my old yamaha and will put up with the clicking sound for a while. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: ARog

customer_reviews.title: Factory Seconds
customer_reviews.text: Like the basic unit. But the first one I got within a couple of weeks started shutting itself off for no reason, called tech support and had to return it as defective. Second one I ordered had, from the packaging, been opened and repackaged, and I found it has a defect in the clear plastic face plate that distorts the view of the display. But at least it's working OK so far, and so I'm not going to return it for cosmetic defect only to get another factory second with a more serious fault.
customer_reviews.author: K. Conover

customer_reviews.title: Terrific and a Solution to broken Sharp Compact Stereo CD players....
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. We bought this to "fix" our defective multi-Cd (vertial format) compact stereo, made by Sharp. This is a quality product, and plugs in nicely to my AUX jack on my stereo system. Its actually far superior than what was buit into the Sharp. Its quite difficult to find this type of item these days... oh oh, it will play MP3 files which are burned onto CD-Rs as well. Love that!
customer_reviews.author: Micster

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price.Minor drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: works most of the time but CDs fit a little loosely. On 1 occasion this caused a jam which took a long time to clear. This rendered it temporarily inoperable and I thought I would have to return it. Preferred the old model it replaced, but after about 20 years this stopped working. On the plus side, the price is very reasonable and plays CDs with no extra noise. Just insert your CDs very carefully.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Works great with system
customer_reviews.text: Works great with system. Just what I expected so we can listen to tracks the way we chose. Keeping this item old school dedicated system for music only. Surround system for TV on a different receiver. this is a proven brand and best price here on Amazon i could find. Best Buy seems moving past such to brands I don't know about.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a very old Kenwood 5 disc changer with this unit. The interface is not quite as good, but only in very subtle ways. (Machine has no memory of which disc you were playing last time it was powered up and always starts at disc 1. Interface to access tracks above track 9 is clunky.) Unit looks good and does exactly what it's supposed to do. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: level_12

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied great for tracks when you can't bring your band together.
customer_reviews.text: I have been needng this product for quite some time and I am glad that I was able to find it, I used it for the 1st time for an event and it worked very well I am pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disc drawer failure first load
customer_reviews.text: Opened it, loaded 6 cds in, watched it go shut, all excited, had to wait for receiver and speakers order while I was waiting opened it and changed the original cds to new ones, put 6 cds in.....and the door/drawer would not go shut. The disc holder is still sitting half open as I box it up to return. I am so disappointed and wanted a CD player so badly... but not keeping something that fails before you can even use it. Amazon is tops on the ease of returning but I don’t want another one and now will have to return the speakers and receiver....hesitate to give even one star.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Blow

customer_reviews.title: I've got a substantial number of CDs, so when ...
customer_reviews.text: I've got a substantial number of CDs, so when the old disc changer went south, I figured there'd be plenty of choice in replacements. Not true! The medium is becoming obsolete year by year, so I appreciated that ONKYO still supplies a straightforward 6-disc changer at a reasonable price. I does what it's supposed to do, and I hope does it for several years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Chas.

customer_reviews.title: It does not work well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these products from Amazon. The first one would stop playing in the middle of a song and sometimes revolve around to the next CD. The second one I bought to replace the first one did the same thing. It would stop playing in the middle of a song. There would be a 10 second gap of silence then the CD would start playing after the 10 second delay. The song would be missing 10 seconds of time. I returned that unit also and bought a Sharp 5 CD player. That one has performed well.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hayden

customer_reviews.title: NICE
customer_reviews.text: WOW this is a great CD player and well worth the $ I payed for it. Easy to use and looks great too. Only problem I had was that the R1 cable that came with it to connect it to my Onkyo receiver was TOO SHORT so I can NOT get my remote to WORK with my receiver...sad because I really need them to...I've looked for a longer one but can't find one anywhere...
customer_reviews.author: Nailgoddess

customer_reviews.title: It lasted 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit in February of 2016. It had good sound and suited our basic entertainment needs. We used it on average less than two hours per week, and then it started to skip so we tried cleaning the head and the skipping did not stop regardless of the discs which played beautifully in other players. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Decent Guy

customer_reviews.title: New CD p[layer
customer_reviews.text: The old one lasted 12 years, I hope this one does too. It is six disc where the last one was five disc so I don't have to load it quite as often. THe buttons are all different but I am adjusting. the sound is great, so far so good. I've had itr for a month.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Pam Clark

customer_reviews.title: Be Ware - it's HUGE!!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old Sony (25 yrs old/gave up ghost) with this - have Teac in another room. Did NOT anticipate how large this thing is!! Place in spot where old 5 disc Sony was - wouldn't fit in cabinet/likewise thought about putting it where Teac is - would fit in that cabinet either (area custom built - used to have projection TV there). BE WARNED -- measure your space; by time you get plugs on back requires 19" depth. Had to cut hole in back of cabinet to accommodate. Upside/so far plays fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jbman

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this item for very long so my review is not based on much yet. So far I like everything about it. It plays well, sounds good and looks great. What more can you ask for. When I burn my own mp3 cd's they play well so at around 4 hours per disc and being able to play six discs.....well you do the math, it is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: ozone

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine
customer_reviews.text: I had not used a CD changer in years. Bluetooth and streaming seemed to be more convenient, but the sound quality finally made me revisit the CD player. This one is built really well, and paired with my Onkyo receiver through the optical connection produces great sound. It's not Blu-ray audio, but in a world where everyone is listening to mediocre streams, it's the next best thing.
customer_reviews.author: Robbey

customer_reviews.title: A loser
customer_reviews.text: I purchased other Onkyo equipment and the items held up very well over years. I purchased this multi-play cd player in September 2018. 14 months later, the player randomly stopped working and actually turned itself off while playing a cd. I followed the manufacturer's remedy and removed the electrical plug from the wall outlet. The player continued to cut off even after at least 6 attempts to correct the problem. I anticipate taking this player to the local landfill. Obviously, I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: It just simply doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I just got my Onkyo DXC390 6-CD player, so far it says no-disks it won't work, I even put in 6 disks, I plugged the white & the red cables from the player into the receiver, why won't it play anything, it just says (NO-DISKS), in the manual it mentions something about a Coaxial cable, why is this mentioned, if it's needed, why didn't the player include one. Can anyone out there help me thru my dilemma, I surely hope so.
customer_reviews.author: J England

customer_reviews.title: Onkyo CD Changer
customer_reviews.text: Although I had to return this unit because it didn’t fit in my Dad’s stereo cabinet, I’m giving it 5 stars, because I have Onkyo components at home in my stereo cabinet, and they are quality components! I’ve never had any issues with my equipment and have had them for over 15 years. That’s why I purchased this unit for my dads birthday when his old unit went out. Unfortunately his old stereo cabinet was just a tad too small for it to fit and hook up to the rest of his equipment. Amazon returned it for me right away and processed my refund without any hassles.
customer_reviews.author: Laura J.

customer_reviews.title: This Thing Is Huge!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't review if it worked or not as all I did was open and realize the unit was bigger than the cabinet I was going to house it in with the rest of my equipment. Boxed it right back up and returned it. I was bigger that any of my other equipment. Should have paid attention to the dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Tidwell

customer_reviews.title: A great 6 disc auto changer.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace an aging JVC disc changer as part of my sound system upgrade. My wife loves a changer as she likes to listed to her CD's while cleaning or working on her crafts. I like this changer as I can change 5 disc's while the 6th is playing, and the carousel is very quiet, unlike the JVC. Then there is the Onkyo name, a long time player in the component field with a good reputation for quality. So far the unit has worked flawlessly as expected, and the optical out delivers great digital sound.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: My old Kenwood unit finally started skipping so when I had to replace it I saw this one and I knew right away that I should buy it since I've had an Onkyo receiver for the last 10 years or so and still works and looks like brand new and back then I wasn't able to find an Onkyo cd charger to match it with. I hope that this one will last as long as my old Kenwood. The unit looks good cosmetic wise is well designed with nice remote features. I'm glad that Onkyo is still making them. I wish that they would put out an EQ unit as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Flash

customer_reviews.title: Great choice
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound and very easy to set up and operate. The random feature and the clear display of the song's names playing makes it my favorite. I wanted to try if I could play my WMA diskettes but with 6 MP3 disks loaded there is enough music to listen and there fore I didn't bother to try the WMA's I would recommend this changer to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Julio Santos

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Well! Quite a unit!! The cd tray is well made & balanced. The controls are simple to understand without instructions. Overall, A++. I'm withholding one "+" for a lack of output control. I am using this changer for my outdoor sound system; which is also connected to XM radio. The XM receiver has a volume control; unfortunately, the changer does not have the ability to regulate output. I would like to achieve balance, from input to input. Other than this issue, I would highly recommend this Onkyo.
customer_reviews.author: CR Mainwearing

customer_reviews.title: The product was quite nice. I only used it briefly as I discovered ...
customer_reviews.text: The product was quite nice. I only used it briefly as I discovered that what was really wrong with my stereo system was my receiver, not my cd changer. I returned this one the next day. It's a bit large compared to some of the new ones, but then again, it held six CD's. Very nice. The supplier, Huppin's of Spokane, shipped this item within two days, unlike whoever is shipping the receiver I have since ordered. I waited six days and no sign of it shipping. I canceled the order.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far very good.
customer_reviews.text: I was really nervous about this purchase, there were such mixed reviews. It was even worse when the delivery driver literally dropped the box marked fragile on it's side and left it there. Imagine my surprise then to discover that this works flawlessly. Yes, the disc change is a little loud, but it is easy to set up and use. So far with 6 discs in shuffle works great, even changed 5 out while one played. No complaints at all so far.
customer_reviews.author: p2v

customer_reviews.title: Old style connections
customer_reviews.text: This player uses old VHS type connectors, not HDMI so won't connect to my new receiver. It claims using a digital connector will sound better, but again, the special cable - purchased separately of course, doesn't connect to new receiver! Lastly (and yeah my bad) but it ONLY PLAYS CD's, NO DVDs!! Wish I had installed it sooner - I would've returned it. Oh yeah, and the universal remote cable - missing!
customer_reviews.author: KForHerbs

customer_reviews.title: This Onkyo handles an additional disc and is working great. Setup was fast and easy
customer_reviews.text: This 6 disc cd changer replaces a TEAC 5 disc changer that was still playing but had tray sticking problems (opening and closing; rotating discs). This Onkyo handles an additional disc and is working great. Setup was fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Furuta

customer_reviews.title: Certainly not the Onkyo of yesteryear
customer_reviews.text: This was great, sounded great, but after less than 2 years of occasional use, it just quit turning on. Unfortunately I didn't buy the extended warranty and Onkyo's site shows a 1 year warranty on CD players, so I am out of luck, but I guess I'll scratch Onkyo off the list while I shop for a replacement. By the way, this had replaced an old CD Player that had lasted closer to 20 years, so it's not like I am hard on them. And maybe expecting something to last more than 2 years is unreasonable. Onkyo seems to think so given its 1 year warranty on them.
customer_reviews.author: J. seger

customer_reviews.title: WORST CD PLAYER EVER PURCHASED
customer_reviews.text: ALERT!!! ALERT!!! IT WILL WORK FINE FOR ABOUT 6 MONTHS THEN START NOT RECOGNIZING CD THAT YOU PUT IN IT NOT ONLY YOUR PERSONALLY BURNT ONE. THE STORE BOUGHT ONES AS WELL. I SENT THE UNIT IN TWICE BECAUSE IT ALSO STARTED TO SKIP WHEN ANYONE IN MY HOUSE WALKED BY IT. THE FIRST TIME THEY SENT IT BACK SAYING IT WAS REPAIRED AND THE SAME THING HAPPENED AGAIN. THEN I SENT IT BACK AGAIN AT THIER REQUEST AND MY COST OVER $36 FOR BOTH SHIPMENTS. AND THEN THEY TOLD ME IT WAS MY DISC HOWEVER i HAVE A PIONEER CD CHANGER AND I CAN PLAY CD'S IN MY BLU RAY BURNING WITH NO PROBLEMS. DON'T BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jon Hill

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this product! Didn't work right out of the box. El crapO
customer_reviews.author: apomersar

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT  CD  PLAYER
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what is advertised. For those individuals who still enjoy CD’s, this piece of audio equipment is superb! The player provides the highs, the middle and the bass sounds clearly and cleanly. Operation of the player is simple. Place it in a safe location, maintain it, clean it and it will provide many years of playback. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: MyShipHasSailed

customer_reviews.title: waste of
customer_reviews.text: During playback Item skips certain disks( brand new - not re-recorderd ones or just locks up and does nothing !! waste of money
customer_reviews.author: ken barbour

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding reasonably priced CD changer from Onkyo.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and use 6 disc CD changer. CDs sound great on my classic high end stereo system. After five years no problems or issues have been experienced. I like having the six disc carousel vs. the five disc offered by other manufactures. Also like the ability to change CDs in the tray while a CD is playing. Highly recommended. If this one should break down one day I will order another one if still available. Kudos to Onkyo for continuing to support the compact disc audio format.
customer_reviews.author: EinAK

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Player
customer_reviews.text: I worried about this unit working right and durability after reading reviews. This player has been a nice surprise ... works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Maggieblue

customer_reviews.title: Test it when you get it
customer_reviews.text: Two months to the day after we ordered this CD player, my husband decides to open the box and use it in the garage. It doesn’t work! He took it to a repair shop after realizing it was 30 days past the return date. It’s going to cost as much to replace the faulty motor as we paid for the player!
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Terrific!
customer_reviews.text: It works - plain and simple. We had a Sony changer for many years that finally gave out. The reviews on this one were excellent as was the price so we thought we'd give it a try. We are pleased with this purchase; it has met all of our expectations and demands. No negatives so far (we've had it now for a couple of months).
customer_reviews.author: Dennis D

customer_reviews.title: Solid Equipment
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this as much as I thought I would, however it's been a solid electrical component. I was even able to fix the unit when the kids broke it. So it is forgiving to work on if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bonnett

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a 30 year old disc player that had quit working-basically the same good quality and does exactly what we wanted
customer_reviews.author: toots

customer_reviews.title: Time for a change
customer_reviews.text: We bought our rack stereo over 34 years ago and some components lasted longer than others. The last remaining one was the CD changer. We did our homework and thought the Onyko DXC390 would be just what we wanted. We were not disappointed. It has given new life to an old system and the clarity is remarkable. It is a quite a bit larger than our old changer so we had to allow for that. Operation with or without the remote is easy and hook up to our old system was about as simple as one could wish for. All in all I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Arlan A. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: "No Disc".... Really??
customer_reviews.text: Unit would not read any discs. Per manual, the CDs that I've played in other players were supposed to be compatible, so that wasn't the problem. Returned for refund, going to try my luck with the local AV store, and a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Baker

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great piece of kit - don't miss it though it looks like a hunk and HULK
customer_reviews.text: It is green on light - just like HULK. It is huge as if it sounds - great and layered soundstage. nice detailing. for that price, you have optical and coaxial inputs. value for money is therefore great. carousel will allow you be freed from disc changing all the time when you need prolong listening. this machine will prove hardware CD from original manufacturer's pressing has a higher quality in sound, durability of the item itself, and more tangible in physical form of music. Thanks to Onkyo that it is still mass producing this and no wonder it stays so long on the top of the chart. it is simply the best cd player now in town.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The CD player is excellent. The sound is great and it’s very easy to change discs, even if one is playing. It was sold as new, but when I went to register it, I was informed it was registered to someone else. I also found out that there is nothing I can do if anything goes wrong except pay for it because the warranty is not in my name. So I knocked off two stars and probably should have done more. If I have trouble with the machine, then there will be a one star review.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: A great CD player
customer_reviews.text: The Onkyo is easy to install. It demands clean cds, and so we have had pay attention to our aged collection. The sounds is magnificent.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Wallace

customer_reviews.title: CD 6 disc CD player.
customer_reviews.text: Player works sometimes. It will quit playing. acts like its stuck. Have cleaned lens and even used brand new CD;s. Sounds good when playing but have to keep starting it up every time it stops. Called customer support and was told I would have to send to repair shop in Phoenix, AZ. and I would have to pay shipping. Repairs are under warranty but I have to contact repair shop to have them done.Long story short-- The CD player is a piece of junk and the customer service sucks. Cost for shipping is almost a third of what I paid so I am going to trash this and buy a new one from somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Mort Wing

customer_reviews.title: completeness
customer_reviews.text: Did not realize I had to buy all those extra parts to listen to my music. I thought I was buying a ready to use unit. I also thought I bought a completely different item. Wanted a turn table to play my records on and a cd player to play my cd's. I was moving at the time I bought this and it went into storage until I got my new place. Imagine my surprise to just receive a cd player. As of now I still do not have the extra units needed to play music. Its just sitting there, quiet and lonely.
customer_reviews.author: Julie A Mills

customer_reviews.title: Great player !
customer_reviews.text: Great for playing all those old CDs - loads six at a time. Caution: Sometimes the CDs may slip out of the carousel - so if you are moving it to another place, unload the CDs first. If they slip out of the carousel while using - just unscrew the cabinet and lift off the top cover - place the CDs back in the carousel and replace the screws.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Reminds me of my old Sony 5 disc changer from the 80's. I hope it lasts as long. I do put it through some hell with my use of the rewind, but that's one of the reasons why I bought it. It has a great sound and it works flawlessly moving back and forth on a track as I replay a phrase as to learn the song properly. I play in a rock cover band and I load this baby up and pick my disc and track just play, play, play. I've had it for a few months now and I think it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Lightning Bill

customer_reviews.title: Clunky but Great Purchase - Update
customer_reviews.text: My kids think I'm a luddite, but I like using CDs. And this is awesome, giving me six hours or more of classical music while I work. Nice while it lasted - not quite two years. I pulled it apart and seemed to get it working, but when I put it back in line, it stopped working. The mechanics seem ok, but even though it will transport discs and select them, it doesn't seem to want to spin them. Again, when on the workbench, the spindle clearly worked. Time to try the Integra six-cd changer.
customer_reviews.author: rhoneyman

customer_reviews.title: MUSIC LOVER
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS 6 DISC CHANGER I HAD TO PURCHASE A AMP FOR IT TO WORK BUT IT WELL WORTH THE MONEY. IT WAS VERY EASY TO CONNECT THE AMP AND SPEAKERS TO THE DISC CHANGER . THE BAD PART IT I STAYED UP TOO LATE ENJOYING IT. I HAD TO GO TO WORK THE NEXT DAY MONEY WELL SPENT. PLEASE GET IT AS A GIFT OR FOR YOURSELF.I WOULD BUY IT AGAIN IN A HEART BEAT!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gloria THOMAS

customer_reviews.title: It’s your choice
customer_reviews.text: The remote is just great to select your options. If you wear progressive eye glasses, it’s so helpful to use the remote to select your choices
customer_reviews.author: James H Harper

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: When my 1980's cartridge CD player died I searched for a decent replacement and although this doesn't take cartridges (no one does, sadly) it holds six CDs at a time, a big plus! It works smoothly, easy to set up and use and the sound quality is great. I'm pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Bixby

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled by positive Reviews. Bought 2 in a row. Both Defective.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one. Disks kept falling off at back of turntable. Exchanged that one for a second one. Disks fell off at back of turntable, as well. Odd to me that two of the same item had the same defect. Phooey.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: SOMETTHING IS WRONG
customer_reviews.text: THIS UNIT LOOKS GOOD EASY TO SET UP, BUT THE SOUND WAS VERY SOFT AND THE AMP. SHUT OFF AS YOU INCREASE THE VOLUME. AT THAT POINT THE SOUND WAS VERY LOW. SO IT'S GOING BACK AND A REPLACEMENT IS ON IT'S WAY. SO HOPEFULLY IT WILL WORK.
customer_reviews.author: FLYINGDRAGONRACING52

customer_reviews.title: Six years . .  Time’s up!
customer_reviews.text: I see I bought this six years ago and it’s just now gone belly up. Not bad, I suppose but as far as I could see from the post mortem - yes, I gave it an autopsy - it was just one tiny component that failed. Otherwise it would have continued to work. So a bit frustrating. But it was a good machine while it lasted. I note I bought it new for a lot less than the current used price!
customer_reviews.author: DJ Jonathan E.

customer_reviews.title: Nice multi-disc CD changer
customer_reviews.text: This unit replaces a Sony 5-disc changer that worked beautifully for several decades and then became unreliable. The Onkyo is reasonably priced, has nice features, and functions as well as the Sony ever did. The Onkyo takes a little more space but that's not a problem for me and being able to accommodate 6 discs is a plus. I like the machine.
customer_reviews.author: windsor383

customer_reviews.title: Competent CD plyer
customer_reviews.text: I have a large CD collection which I enjoy despite streaming being available but of low bandwidth locally. My old player was skipping a lot. This player does a much better job plus being able to load 6 disks at a time. Price was acceptable. Also, I was afraid this technology might soon be unavailable. Plugged into my ancient receiver/amp with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: J at Kwaj

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: After owning a somewhat problematic Onkyo 6 disc CD changer for many years (it would skip discs, or stop playing, or get stuck), I swore I'd never buy another Onkyo product. After reading many reviews on this one, I decided to try another, and I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rus O.

customer_reviews.title: Product and seller fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This is something I’ve waited for and research extensively. The original box was damaged and this seller replaced it immediately, completely hassle free. The product is in excellent shape and works prefectly and sounds great. I will 100% recommended this seller and will buy from him again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: bad seed
customer_reviews.text: This one is odd ,does not work. I have the same model ,it works fine. Never got to use it.This one would not open and it displayed as if disks were loaded. I should not have to pay for a restocking fee for a damaged item.
customer_reviews.author: eddie

customer_reviews.title: Got a dud. Trying again.
customer_reviews.text: Used it three times and not it will not recognize any disks.Keep getting NO DISK message even tho it is full of discs. Contacted company and they offered a full refund. Will try another. Liked it when it worked. :)
customer_reviews.author: Rex L.

customer_reviews.title: Great player but will eventually glitch
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome CD player and there aren't many choices nowadays. Unfortunately, you will eventually experience what others have stated here. It will sometimes skip over CD's and start playing the next one in line So far I have had good luck in unplugging the player to reboot it and it starts working ok again. Despite this glitch I still love this player.
customer_reviews.author: ChasieB

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice Of multi-disc CD player
customer_reviews.text: I found the installation to take about 10 minutes, mostly due to moving other equipment around. The connection took about 30 seconds. The sound quality is excellent. I bought this unit because I've been looking for a multi-disc changer that could shuffle sound tracks from multiple discs instead of just from one disc. The shuffle function (Random Play) works as expected. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: NICE CD CHANGER
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because I like to listen to audio stories while in bed although I fall asleep before they finish! I wanted a changer because being lazy I didn't want to keep getting out of bed to insert another disc if I was still awake! The volume control is very small with only 3 buttons. It would have been nice if it was a little bigger as it is very easy to loose it in the sheets!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissie

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!! Had a tough time finding a CD ...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE!! Had a tough time finding a CD player for a home stereo system. Old school I guess! I'm not all about downloading, I love being able to play my CD collection again, after my original one finally quit on me after several years. This works excellent!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy P.

customer_reviews.title: Died after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Unit worked fine until 3 months later. It would not come out of standby. I looked online and this failure seems to be common with this model. I could not fix it myself and cost to repair approaches the cost of buying something else. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Behold105

customer_reviews.title: A large component with flexible features
customer_reviews.text: I still want to play CDs and my 30 year old Sony 5-disc component failed after a recent repair. The Onkyo was easy to install, the manual is easy to understand, and we are happy with it. A nice change from Apple Music, Amazon etc. It is a large unit and you will need to take that into consideration. Overall, delighted we bought it at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Hubbard

product_meta.title: Onkyo DXC390 6 Disc CD Changer,Black
product_meta.description:
Style:DX-C390Music lovers rejoice! Those looking for the ultimate in CD playback from an audiophile-grade component will be impressed with a high-precision, multi-bit D/A converter and 128 x oversampling. Others looking for convenience will thrill at the sight of 6-disc capability, 6 repeat modes, 40 track programming—and no worries about interruptions to your music, with the ability to change 5 discs while the last one is still playing. All will marvel at the crystal-clear playback, enhanced by our exclusive VLSC (Vector Linear Shaping Circuitry), for a smoother sounding audio signal. Just as crucial to your sonic enjoyment is Direct Digital Path, a heavily shielded, high-quality cable that protects the delicate audio signal from noise emitted by the surrounding circuits. Housed in a sturdy chassis graced with a brushed aluminum front panel, the DX-C390 is ready to provide hours of uninterrupted music—for the soundtrack to your life. Key Technology Features: 192 kHz/24bit AD Converters: Costly, extremely powerful digital-to-analog converters , that not only boast a dynamic range of 120 dB, they process information faster and are virtually resistant to clock jitter, to ensure the best possible performance from DVD-Audio, DVD-Video and audio CD.RI (Remote Interactive): With Onkyo’s exclusive RI (Remote Interactive) system capability, you can integrate and operate all compatible components through a single remote control. What’s more, RI capability enables you to simply connect the iPod to your receiver through Onkyo’s RI Dock for the iPod (DS-A1). Your iPod effectively becomes another Onkyo component from which you can relish a fuller sound that just can’t be experienced through headphones. RI capability will also give you remote operability of your iPod for hands-off control over your digital music. VLSC (Vector Linear Shaping Circuitry): Conventional D/A conversion methods reduce digital pulse noise at the conversion stage but can’t remove it completely. Previously only found on our high-end components, VLSC (Vector Linear Shaping Circuitry) employs a unique D/A conversion circuit to overcome this problem. Data is converted between sampling points and these points are joined with analog vectors in real-time to produce a smooth output wave form. The result — a virtually noiseless, smooth analog signal based on the digital source to bring out even the most subtle of nuances in your music, movie soundtracks and even MP3s. MP3 Playback: This audio format achieves about a 10:1 compression over conventional CD audio. What does this mean? You can store many more songs using the same amount of space. For example, a standard 650MB CD can hold more than 200 songs in MP3 format. Various bitrates allow for higher or lower quality, depending on the desired sound quality of the final recording.

AMAZON.COM

 RI (Remote Interactive): With Onkyos exclusive RI (Remote Interactive) system capability, you can integrate and operate all compatible components through a single remote control. Whats more, RI capability enables you to simply connect the iPod® to your receiver through Onkyos RI Dock for the iPod (DS-A1). Your iPod effectively becomes another Onkyo component from which you can relish a fuller sound that just cant be experienced through headphones. RI capability will also give you remote operability of your iPod for hands-off control over your digital music. 

 VLSC (Vector Linear Shaping Circuitry): Conventional D/A conversion methods reduce digital pulse noise at the conversion stage but cant remove it completely. Previously only found on our high-end components, VLSC (Vector Linear Shaping Circuitry) employs a unique D/A conversion circuit to overcome this problem. Data is converted between sampling points and these points are joined with analog vectors in real-time to produce a smooth output wave form. The result a virtually noiseless, smooth analog signal based on the digital source to bring out even the most subtle of nuances in your music, movie soundtracks and even MP3s. 

 MP3 Playback: This audio format achieves about a 10:1 compression over conventional CD audio. What does this mean? You can store many more songs using the same amount of space. For example, a standard 650MB CD can hold more than 200 songs in MP3 format. Various bitrates allow for higher or lower quality, depending on the desired sound quality of the final recording.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Onkyo 6 Disc CD Player DXC390

See more
feature_bullets: Remove and replace 5 CDs as one continues to play. Dimensions (W x H x D):17 1/8 inch x 5 3/16 inch x 17 1/16 inch
Plays Audio CDs, MP3-Encoded CDs, CD-R/RWs*, Digital filter 352.8 kHz
192 kHz/24-Bit Audio DAC and Direct Digital Path;Frequency Response : 5 Hz-20 kHz
40-Track Programming, 6 Repeat Modes (Entire Disc/All Discs/Random Tracks/Programmed Tracks/Random Memory/Single Track)
Brushed Hairline Aluminum Front Panel and RI (Remote Interactive) Remote Control
